page.title: 13Water Resources
page.content:
The downland west of Eastbourne is an important area for water catchment. Rain water drains through the porous chalk to collect at the water table. The water is then drawn to the surface by a number of pumping stations on the top of the Downs. It is either used for farm irrigation or pumped into reservoirs. These reservoirs provide water for Eastbourne's population of 80,000.
Farmers are prevented from using large quantities of chemical fertilizer on the land for fear of contaminating this water supply. Also a number of dew ponds have been built on top of the Downs to provide water holes for wildlife.
